boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Das Schicksalsrad
Carcassonne: Het Rad van Fortuin
Carcassonne: Wheel of Fortune
boardgame.description: Carcassonne: Das Schicksalsrad (English: Wheel of Fortune) is both a full replacement for the base game of Carcassonne and an expansion to the original base game. It includes 72 tiles, consisting of 63 tiles released in the original base game, 6 from Inns _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Cathedrals, 1 from Traders _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Builders and 2 from King _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Scout. It also includes a special replacement start tile which depicts the Wheel of Fortune, a new mechanic unique to this edition of the game. The new start tile is the size of 16 tiles, arranged in a 4_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;times;4 square and is built using some of the tiles removed from the base game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Nineteen tiles from the game have numbers printed on them allowing players to randomly spin the Wheel of Fate (between 1 and 3 spaces around the wheel). Otherwise, a player may choose to place a follower on the wheel if they decline placing a follower that turn. The results of the Wheel vary depending on which of the sixths of the wheel the pig lands on. Results vary from forcing all players to remove a follower from the board to rewarding the player who moves the pig with three bonus points. There are six outcomes in all._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Play of this game does not require ownership of any Carcassonne base game. All expansions are compatible with this game. This game can also be played with the base game as an expansion, using its wagon wheel watermark to differentiate it from the base game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The German edition of this game includes a book Carcassonne -_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;nbsp;Das Schicksalsrad by Helene Luise K_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ouml;ppel._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The English edition of the game was released in October 2009 by Rio Grande Games._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Part of the Carcassonne series._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Rio Grande Games (RIO 396) Type: Area control Number of players: 2-5 Age of players: 8++ Length: 30-45 minutes Game Description: A clever tile-laying game. The southern French city of Carcassonne is famous for its unique Roman and Medieval fortifications. The players develop the area around Carcassonne and deploy their followers on the roads, in the cities, in the cloisters, and in the fields. The skill of the players to develop the area will determine who is victorious. This game is very similar to the original Carcassonne, but it adds the wheel of fortune, which gives players new options and adds fun to the game. It is a stand-alone game, not an expansion.

Rio Grande Games - Carcassonne: Wheel of Fortune Language: English Players: 2 to 5 Age: 8+ Duration: 30 to 45 min Weight: 0.760 kg New -- mint condition -- unopened -- still in shrink wrap. Theme: For many years knights, monks, thieves and farmers attended to their activities without interruption. But now a mysterious wheel of fortune determines the fate of the things in Carcassonne. The plague sends followers home and famines must fought. In addition, the players earn additional points when their knights collects taxes. A player who is in the right place at the right time steer his fate in right direction. For those players who familiar with Carcassonne playing the game will come easily as the wheel adds only a few easily understood rules, which offer a completely new game experience. Additionally, this game can be player with the original Carcassonne and all its published expansions for even larger adventures. See Details (more info) or below for complete selling, payment and shipping conditions.
Dutch version
